name: Forward Arm Circles
how_to_perform:
1. Hold your arms straight out to the sides at shoulder height, with your palms facing down.
2. Keeping your upper arms still, use only your forearms and hands to move your arms in a circular motion forward.
3. Gradually increase the size of your circles until you are making large arcs with your arms in front of you.
4. Slowly decrease the size of the circles until they are small again.
5. Repeat this process for 3 sets, resting for 30 seconds between each set.
short_summary: Forward arm circles are an exercise that targets the shoulders and improves flexibility and mobility in the shoulder joint.
